record_data.record_title: Shared Facilities Agreement, Rate Schedule FERC No. 2
record_data.record_plain_text:
SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT THIS SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”), is entered into as of November 30, 2010 (the “Effective Date”), by and between Ashtabula Wind, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Ashtabula I”) and Ashtabula Wind III, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Ashtabula III”). Ashtabula I and Ashtabula III may be referred to herein individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.” RECITALS WHEREAS, Ashtabula I owns and/or operates a 148.5MW wind-powered electric generating facility located approximately 60 miles west of Fargo, North Dakota in Barnes County, North Dakota (the “Ashtabula I Project”); WHEREAS, Ashtabula III is developing an approximately 62.4 MW wind-powered electric generating facility located approximately in the same area as the Ashtabula I Project (the “Ashtabula III Project”); WHEREAS, Ashtabula I owns, leases and/or operates certain personal property, real property, fixtures, easements, equipment and facilities described in Exhibit A attached hereto (the “Shared Facilities”) that are necessary for the operation and maintenance of the Ashtabula I Project, the Ashtabula III Project and a 48 MW wind-powered generating facility which is owned by Otter Tail Power Company (formerly known as Otter Tail Corporation d/b/a Otter Tail Power Company), a Minnesota corporation (“Otter Tail”) that is adjacent to the Ashtabula I Project and the Ashtabula III Project (the “Otter Tail Project”); and WHEREAS, Ashtabula I desires to grant Ashtabula III the right to utilize the Shared Facilities on the terms and conditions set forth herein. NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties hereby agree as follows: AGREEMENT 1. TERM; EARLY TERMINATION 1.1 Term: The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue in effect until terminated (a) by mutual agreement of the Parties or (b) pursuant to Section 1.2 of this Agreement. 1.2 Early Termination: This Agreement shall automatically terminate, without further action by either Party and without further liability of one Party to the other, upon the date that each of Ashtabula I and Ashtabula III or their successors and assigns have permanently ceased operation of the Ashtabula I Project and the Ashtabula III Project, respectively, for the production of electric energy.
2. GRANT OF SHARED FACILITIES RIGHTS 2.1 Grant: Ashtabula I hereby grants to Ashtabula III, during the term of this Agreement, and on the terms and subject to the conditions hereof, the non-exclusive right to access and utilize the Shared Facilities as may be reasonably necessary in connection with Ashtabula III’s ownership, operation and maintenance of the Ashtabula III Project. 2.2 Essential Nature: Ashtabula I hereby acknowledges that Ashtabula III’s rights to utilize the Shared Facilities are essential to the operation and maintenance of Ashtabula III Project. 2.3 Vesting: The right to access and utilize the Shared Facilities granted to Ashtabula III hereunder shall vest in Ashtabula III as a contracting party hereunder without any transfer of title or leasehold interest in the Shared Facilities. 2.4 License Fee: In consideration of the right to access and utilize the Shared Facilities, Ashtabula III agrees to pay to Ashtabula I a one-time license fee (the “License Fee”) based on Ashtabula III’s pro rata share of the total, aggregate costs, fee and expenses incurred by Ashtabula I for development, real estate rights, and engineering, procurement and construction of the Shared Facilities (including those costs already paid by Otter Tail to Ashtabula pursuant to the Amended and Restated Common Facilities Agreement by and between Otter Tail and Ashtabula Wind, LLC (“Common Facilities Agreement”)), with such pro rata share calculated based on the MW capacity owned by Ashtabula III as against the overall MW capacity of generating facilities using the Shared Facilities, including the Otter Tail Project. Such License Fee shall be paid by Ashtabula III to Ashtabula I within thirty (30) days of commercial operation of Ashtabula III. 3. NATURE OF SHARED FACILITIES RIGHTS
3.1 Limitation on Grant: Subject to Section 3.3, Ashtabula I grants the Shared Facilities rights to Ashtabula III under this Agreement, to the extent that such rights do not limit in any material respect the ability of Ashtabula I to perform its obligations under any agreement regarding the Shared Facilities, as the same may be hereafter modified or amended, that Ashtabula I has entered into, or enters into after the date hereof, including the Common Facilities Agreement. 3.2 Assignment or Transfer: Except as set forth in Section 8.8, Ashtabula III shall not assign the rights granted hereunder or grant any permission, license, right of way or similar right to the rights granted hereunder without the prior written consent of Ashtabula I. 3.3 Interference: In no event shall either Party be entitled to exercise its rights to access and utilize the Shared Facilities if the exercise of such rights would materially interfere with or limit the reasonable and necessary access and utilization of the Shared Facilities by the other Party. Ashtabula I and Ashtabula III each recognize that, consistent with Section 9(f) of the Common Facilities Agreement, if curtailments of the Ashtabula I Project, the Otter Tail Project, and the Ashtabula III Project are necessary, the Ashtabula III Project shall be curtailed before the Ashtabula I Project and the Otter Tail Project are curtailed.
3.4 Prior Written Consent: Subject to 3.1, Ashtabula I shall not take any action that results in the forbearance, foreclosure, termination or alteration of Ashtabula III’s access to, utilization of or reliance upon the Shared Facilities without the prior written consent of Ashtabula III. 4. MAINTENANCE OF SHARED FACILITIES 4.1 Allocation of Certain Costs and Expenses: As among Ashtabula I and Ashtabula III, subject to Section 2.4 above, Ashtabula I shall be responsible for the costs of ownership or possession, operation, inspection, maintenance, repair, alteration, relocation, improvement and replacement of the Shared Facilities. 4.2 Successor Agreement: In the event that the Ashtabula I Project and the Ashtabula III Project are no longer operated and maintained by a single entity for any reason, the Parties agree to use good faith efforts to negotiate mutually agreeable terms and execute a mutually agreeable agreement (or amendment to this Agreement) that specifies the division of responsibilities of the entities providing operation and maintenance services associated with the Shared Facilities for the Ashtabula I Project and the Ashtabula III Project. If the Parties are unable to reach such agreement on the terms and conditions that would replace or amend this Agreement, then the Party providing services on the Shared Facilities shall file an unexecuted agreement with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission pursuant to Section 205 of the Federal Power Act or its successor, and each Party reserves all rights under the Federal Power Act or its successor. 5. CHANGE IN OWNERSHIP; CHANGE IN LAW 5.1 Change in Common Beneficial Ownership: In the event that the membership interests of Ashtabula I and Ashtabula III are not at least 50% beneficially owned by the same direct or indirect parent entity, the Parties agree to use good faith efforts to negotiate (a) and implement a mutually acceptable ownership structure of the Shared Facilities that provides for the common ownership of the Shared Facilities by Ashtabula I and Ashtabula III and (b) mutually agreeable terms and execute a mutually agreeable agreement (or amendment to this Agreement) that recognizes such common ownership of the Shared Facilities. If the Parties are unable to reach such agreement on the terms and conditions that would replace or amend this Agreement, then the Party providing services on the Shared Facilities shall file an unexecuted agreement with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission pursuant to Section 205 of the Federal Power Act or its successor, and each Party reserves all rights under the Federal Power Act or its successor. 5.2 Change in Law: In the event that a change in the ownership of Ashtabula I and/or Ashtabula III or a change in the laws or regulations applicable to the Ashtabula I Project, the Ashtabula III Project or this Agreement requires the amendment, modification or replacement of this Agreement in order to satisfy any applicable federal, state or local regulatory requirements, the Parties agree to use good faith efforts to negotiate and implement mutually agreeable terms to accomplish such amendment, modification or replacement. If the Parties are unable to reach such agreement on the terms and conditions that would replace or amend this Agreement, then the Party providing services on the Shared Facilities shall file an unexecuted agreement with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission pursuant to Section 205 of the Federal Power Act or its successor, and each Party reserves all rights under the Federal Power Act or its successor. 6. MATERIAL BREACH 6.1 Material Breach by Ashtabula III. In the event of any material breach of this Agreement by Ashtabula III and Ashtabula III’s failure to cure such breach within a reasonable time not to exceed thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice from Ashtabula I describing such breach, Ashtabula I shall have the right, in addition to all remedies available to Ashtabula I at law or in equity, to (i) cure the breach on behalf of Ashtabula III, (ii) suspend Ashtabula III’s access to the Shared Facilities for so long as such default shall be continuing and remain uncured, or (iii) terminate this Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, the remedy specified in clause (i) may be exercised, without prejudice to any right or remedy of Ashtabula I hereunder, by any lender of Ashtabula I. If Ashtabula I (or any lender thereof) chooses to cure Ashtabula III’s default, Ashtabula III shall reimburse Ashtabula I (or such lender) upon demand for all commercially reasonable costs incurred by Ashtabula I in curing such breach. 6.2 Material Breach by Ashtabula I. In the event of any material breach of this Agreement by Ashtabula I and Ashtabula I’s failure to cure such breach within a reasonable time not to exceed thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice from Ashtabula III describing such breach, Ashtabula III shall have the right, in addition to all remedies available to Ashtabula III at law or in equity, to (i) cure the breach on behalf of Ashtabula I, or (ii) terminate this Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, the remedy specified in clause (i) may be exercised, without prejudice to any right or remedy of Ashtabula III hereunder, by any lender of Ashtabula III. If Ashtabula III (or any lender thereof) chooses to cure any such breach on behalf of Ashtabula I, Ashtabula I shall reimburse Ashtabula III (or such lender) upon demand for all commercially reasonable costs incurred by Ashtabula III in curing such breach. 7. FORCE MAJEURE 7.1 Force Majeure. In the event of an act of God, government order or restraint, war (declared or undeclared) or warlike conditions, act of terrorism, blockade, revolution, strike, lockout, civil commotion, fire, flood, storm, epidemic or any other occurrence beyond a Party’s reasonable control (each a “Force Majeure Event”), such Party shall promptly notify the other Party thereof and, so long as such condition shall persist, such Party shall not be liable for the delay in performance of, or the failure to perform, its obligations (other than obligations for payment of amounts due hereunder) under this Agreement caused directly or indirectly thereby. The claiming Party shall give the other Party notice describing the particulars of the Force Majeure Event. Within fifteen (15) days after giving notice of the Force Majeure Event, the claiming Party shall give the other Party an estimate of the Force Majeure Event’s expected duration and probable impact. The claiming Party shall continue to furnish the other Party with timely regular reports during the continuation of the Force Majeure Event. Each Party shall immediately exercise commercially reasonable efforts to mitigate or limit the impact to its obligations hereunder as a result of the Force Majeure Event. 8. MISCELLANEOUS 8.1 Agreement to Cooperate. Each Party agrees to reasonably cooperate with the other Party so that, subject to the terms of this Agreement, each of the Ashtabula I Project and the Ashtabula III Project benefits from the full utilization and enjoyment of the Shared Facilities as is necessary for the efficient operation of each such wind energy project. 8.2 Relationship of Parties. The Parties do not intend to create hereby any joint venture, partnership, association or any other entity for the conduct of any business and (b) nothing herein shall be deemed to authorize either Party to act on behalf of the other Party. 8.3 Non-Interference. Subject to Section 3.3, each Party agrees not to interfere with the reasonable and necessary utilization of the Shared Facilities by the other Party as permitted hereunder. 8.4 Modification and Amendment. The terms of this Agreement may only be modified or amended in a writing signed by all of the Parties. 8.5 Waiver. The failure of a Party to insist upon or enforce strict performance of any of the provisions of this Agreement or to exercise any rights or remedies under this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver or relinquishment to any extent of such Party’s right to assert or rely upon any such provisions, rights, and remedies in that or any other instance; rather, the same shall be and remain in full force and effect. 8.6 Enforceability. Any provision of this Agreement which is prohibited or unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall, as to such jurisdiction, be ineffective only to the extent of such prohibition, but shall be effective to the extent of such remaining provisions hereof. 8.7 Transfer of Shared Facilities. Except as set forth in Section 8.8, Ashtabula I may not transfer, sell, assign or sub-lease its ownership interest in the Shared Facilities or any portion thereof without the prior written consent of Ashtabula III. 8.8 Assignment. Neither Party may assign its rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other Party, provided that either Party may collaterally assign this Agreement to any entity, or such entity’s agent, in connection with a financing or a refinancing that that is directly or indirectly secured in whole or in part by the Ashtabula I Project or the Ashtabula III Project, as applicable. 8.9 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and constructed in accordance with the laws of the State of North Dakota, without regard to its conflict of laws provisions. 8.10 Inspection of Records. Each Party shall have access to any records concerning the Shared Facilities held by the other Party upon reasonable notice and at reasonable times. 8.11 Section Headings. The section headings in this Agreement are for convenience of reference only and shall not modify, define, expand, or limit any of the terms or provisions hereof. 8.12 Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which when so executed shall be deemed an original, and all of which when taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument. [SIGNATURES APPEAR ON FOLLOWING PAGE]
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have caused this Shared Facilities Agreement to be executed as of the date first written above.
ASHTABULA WIND, LLC
By:/s/ Name: Charles S. Schultz Title: Secretary
ASHTABULA WIND III, LLC
By: /s/ Name: Charles S. Schultz Title: Secretary
EXHIBIT A SHARED FACILITIES
The “Shared Facilities” shall consist of the following: 1. Operations and Maintenance Building. The operations and maintenance building of Ashtabula Wind, LLC used to store equipment and inventory for the Ashtabula I Project, the Ashtabula III Project, and certain other wind generation facilities, together with any replacement, expansions, modifications, improvements or additions thereto. 2. Interconnection transmission line between the Barnes and Pillsbury 230kV Substations. 3. Protection and Control equipment located at the Barnes Substation. 4. Output buswork at the Barnes Substation (including stringbus)
5. Any portion of the communication pathway necessary for the operation of the Ashtabula I Project and Ashtabula III Project, to include the optical ground wire and microwave communication system, excluding equipment and software owned by Ashtabula III. 6. Access roads, gates, fences and secure storage facilities.
record_data.filing_title: Ashtabula Wind, LLC and Ashtabula Wind III, LLC SFA Filing
